title: Gift for a Coffee Lover Who Doesn't Have a Machine
headline: They love coffee but they have never made their own espresso. Change that.
editorial_intro: Buying someone their first espresso machine is one of those gifts that changes a daily habit permanently. The key is choosing something approachable enough that they actually use it, not something that intimidates them into leaving it in the box.

products.description: The Nano is the least intimidating espresso machine Arco makes, and that is deliberate. It heats up in 60 seconds, occupies less counter space than a toaster, and produces shots that will genuinely surprise someone used to instant coffee or capsules. If they live in a small flat or have never expressed interest in 'becoming a barista,' this is the right choice.

If they travel frequently or live somewhere without a fixed kitchen setup, the Viaggio is an unexpectedly delightful gift. It weighs 340 grams, needs no electricity, and makes real espresso using a manual lever. Pair it with a bag of freshly roasted beans and you have given them something they will use on every trip.

The Primo is the gift that says: I believe you will take this seriously. A proper single-boiler espresso machine with a 58mm portafilter, 90-second heat-up, and the kind of build quality that lasts for years. This is the entry point that does not feel like a compromise.

If the budget allows, pair the Primo with a Macinino grinder. Fresh grinding is the single biggest factor in espresso quality, and a good entry-level grinder transforms the experience from 'pretty good' to 'wait, I made this?' Consider the Morning Minimalist Kit for the best value on this combination.
